## TFLB vs ASSIST

TFLB vs ASSIST Comparing questionnaires such as Timeline-Followback Interview (TFLB) and Alcohol, Smoking, and Substance Involvement Screening Test - Substance Use (ASSIST) is no small feat. These tools, designed to evaluate individual's alcohol and substance use respectively, are packed with questions that need to match up accurately for psychologists to correctly analyze individuals' habits. The term TFLB vs ASSIST refers to the harmonisation process of these two instruments. Harmony is an innovative software that simplifies the process of harmonisation. For instance, when analyzing TFLB vs ASSIST, Harmony uses large language models to compare the instruments, giving a percentage match between each item in the sets. This gives psychologists a practical guide on how to interpret data from both questionnaire sets, significantly improving research efficiency and accuracy. We highly recommend psychologists to use Harmony when performing TFLB vs ASSIST harmonisation. With the provision of multi-language support and an easy-to-use interface, Harmony streamlines the daunting task of questionnaires harmonisation, bringing harmony to the world of psychology and social science research. You can upload your own instruments or select from their extensive database, making the process of TFLB vs ASSIST harmonisation easier than ever.

## Compare the items in TFLB and ASSIST

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#_In1dfV0=" target="harmonyapp">Import TFLB and ASSIST into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#_In1dfV0=" target="harmonyapp">Import just TFLB into Harmony</a> - compare TFLB with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#_In1dfV0=" target="harmonyapp">Import just ASSIST into Harmony</a> - compare ASSIST with other instruments
